{"step_by_step_thinking": "Mother to child transmission of HIV can be decreased by several methods. Avoiding breastfeeding (option A) can reduce transmission as the virus can be present in breast milk. Zidovudine given to the mother antenatally and to the neonate after birth (option C) is a known method to reduce transmission. Vitamin A supplementation given to the mother (option D) has been shown in some studies to reduce transmission. However, vaginal delivery (option B) does not decrease the transmission of HIV from mother to child. In fact, it may increase the risk compared to a cesarean section.", "answer_choice": "B"}
